name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TheBohraThaal
organizer.description: The Bohra Thaal offers a unique home dining experience, bringing the rich traditions of Bohra cuisine to your table. Dine the authentic way—sharing a giant Thaal, savoring a curated 9-course feast, and connecting over food in a warm, welcoming home. Come as strangers, leave as friends!

name: Brigade road heritage walk.
description: Join us as we revive our cherished walks through the historic Cantonment this year. Step back in time as we trace the origins of this storied district once the heart of colonial Bangalore.On this journey we will explore a magnificent church that has stood the test of time pay homage at a solemn war memorial and admire a beautifully restored heritage structure. Along the way we will encounter stately British-era government buildings a statue of a notable foreigner and a road steeped in its own fascinating history.Every corner of the Cantonment whispers tales of its past—stories of soldiers administrators and the many communities that shaped this unique enclave. Join us as we rediscover its enduring legacy one step at a time.

location.address: 15K, Brigade Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560025, India

organizer.name: Bengaluru by foot
organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Memories in Fragments: A Tribute to Chinnammu Amma
description: Memories in Fragments: A Tribute to Chinnammu Amma A Mohiniyattam Recital by Amith K.This Mohiniyattam recital by Amith K is a tribute to the hereditary dancer Thottasshery Chinnammu Amma, whose name has nearly disappeared from public memory. The pieces presented are learned from Kalamandalam Chandrika, a direct disciple of Chinnammu Amma, and are carried through the embodied memories of two women dancers.Rooted in tradition yet deeply personal, this performance honors a forgotten lineage in Mohiniyattam. It brings visibility to Chinnammu Amma’s legacy while also acknowledging the continued influence of Amith’s teachers, Nirmala Paniker and Kalamandalam Chandrika. Through this recital, Amith opens a space to reflect on the form’s history, memory, and transmission.Vocal: Rohith AneeshNattuvangam: Sreenima N P.Amith K.Amith K is a scholar, dancer, and choreographer with a PhD from Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit, Kalady. His work explores the intersections of caste, culture, and history in modern Kerala, with writings on gender, dance, and society. Through Mohiniyattam, he challenges hierarchies within the art world, blending scholarship and performance.

location.address: 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Samyoga: Khayal se Kriti tak (unplugged)
description: Samyoga – Khayal Se Kriti TakA unique confluence of Hindustani and Carnatic musical traditionsSamyoga – meaning union or coming together – is an evocative musical production that intricately weaves together the rich threads of India’s two great classical traditions: Hindustani and Carnatic music. Conceptualised and presented by Dr. Radhika Joshi (Hindustani Vocal) and Manasi Prasad (Carnatic Vocal), Samyoga is a celebration of both the shared roots and the distinctive aesthetics of these traditions. This presentation of Samyoga will be an unplugged, voice-only exploration, where two voices come together, accompanied by live tanpuras to create an immersive and meditative musical experience.Traversing the expanse of Indian music, the concert explores genres ranging from the gravitas of classical forms to the devotional depth of Bhakti Sangeet, and from the emotive beauty of Thumri and Jawali to the dramatic expressiveness of Natyasangeet. Each piece is carefully curated to highlight both the convergence and divergence in approach, structure, and emotion across the two systems.Through a seamless blend of performance and narration, Samyoga offers audiences more than just a concert—it presents a musical journey, providing insights into the evolution, nuances, and interconnections between genres. Interestingly, both Radhika and Manasi are alumni of the Indian Institute of Management, Bangalore, who chose to follow their hearts into the world of music. Today, they are recognised not only as accomplished performers but also as dedicated researchers in the field of Indian music.

name: Indian Ocean : Live at Hamilton
description: Get ready, Bengaluru — the legends are coming.Brace yourself for a soul-stirring night as Indian Ocean, India’s iconic folk-rock powerhouse, takes the stage at Hamilton for an unforgettable live performance.From Kandisa to Bandeh, experience the sound that defined a generation — raw, powerful, and deeply rooted in the Indian spirit.Pair the performance with our signature cocktails and electric vibe. It’s the perfect mix of great music, good drinks, and even better company.

name: Wonderla with Strangers
description: 🎡 WONDERLA WITH STRANGERS – A WILD SATURDAY ESCAPEDate: 24th August Age Group: 18–35 onlyPrice: ₹3500/person(Includes AC transport + Regular Adult Entry Ticket)🚍 One Day. One Group. All the Thrill.9:00 AM – Departure from Bangalore Meet your fun crew of handpicked strangers and kickstart the day with a lively group ride. Games, music, and banter on board!10:30 AM – Arrive at Wonderla Bangalore Your tickets will be sorted. Lockers can be arranged (at extra cost). Quick briefing by your trip captain – and off we go!11:00 AM – 5:30 PM – Wonderla Madness – Together 🎢 Conquer high-speed rides 🌊 Dive into water coasters, wave pools & rain dance 🎮 Group rides, shared laughs, and team selfies throughout – this is a full group experience led by your trip captain!1:30 PM – Lunch Break (inside park) Enjoy lunch with your new gang (self-paid), chill a bit, then back to more rides.5:30 PM – Group Exit & Regroup Wrap up the fun, click a group photo, and settle in for the ride back.6:00 PM – Depart from Wonderla Time to relive the highlights, vibe together one last time, and share Insta handles.7:00 PM – Reach Bangalore Trip ends, new friendships begin.✅ Inclusions:AC Group Transport (Bangalore ⇌ Wonderla)Wonderla Regular Adult Entry Ticket (Not Fast Track)Trip Captain to lead & coordinate the full dayCurated group of solo travelers (18–35 only)🧡 Not a family trip. Not a school trip. Just 1 day of pure fun with like-minded strangers.📲 DM to book or join the WhatsApp group: +91 8867023837 Seats are limited. Come solo, vibe with the crew, leave with memories!

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones).We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table. E-books are allowed)**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours!

name: Clay Magnets Workshop
description: Clay Magnets Workshop – A Fun and Creative Experience for All Ages!Step into a world of colour, imagination, and hands-on creativity at our Clay Magnets Workshop at Fired Up Studio! Whether you’re a seasoned crafter or a complete beginner, this workshop is a great way to unwind, explore a new medium, and make something unique and personal with your own hands.In this engaging 2.5-hour session, participants will learn to create charming, quirky fridge magnets using Shilpkar, a lightweight air-dry clay that’s easy to shape and perfect for beginners. Our experienced instructors will guide you through each step of the process—from shaping and sculpting the clay to painting and finishing your pieces.You’ll start by learning basic clay modeling techniques and how to work with miniature forms. Then, choose from a variety of fun designs or come up with your own ideas—animals, foods, emojis, flowers, or your favourite characters! After sculpting, we’ll show you how to add details using vibrant acrylic paints. Once dried, each piece will be fitted with a strong magnet so you can take home your finished creations, ready to display on your fridge or magnetic board.Each participant will make 3 to 4 magnets during the session, and all materials—including clay, sculpting tools, paints, brushes, and magnets—will be provided. You don’t need to bring anything except your creativity!What’s Included:Step-by-step guidance by a skilled instructorHands-on clay sculpting and paintingAll supplies and tools provided3 to 4 completed magnets to take homeFun, relaxed, and creative atmosphereWho Can Join:This workshop is open to ages 5 and above. It’s perfect for kids, adults, families, friends, or even colleagues looking for a unique team activity. Parents are welcome to join their kids in the session or work alongside them.Why You’ll Love It:Express Yourself: Create tiny works of art that reflect your personality.Learn Something New: Discover the basics of clay modeling and acrylic painting.Take a Break: Get away from screens and daily stress in a relaxing, artistic environment.Make Memories: Great for parent-child bonding, friend groups, or solo self-care.Whether you're looking to explore a new hobby, spend quality time with your child, or simply enjoy a creative afternoon, our Clay Magnets Workshop is a delightful and rewarding experience.Join us at Fired Up Studio and let your creativity come to life—one tiny magnet at a time!Duration: 2.5 hours Age Group: 5+ Materials: All included Location: Fired Up Studio, Bangalore Booking: Limited spots available—reserve yours

location.address: Shop No. 5, 153 Biere St, Hagadur Main Rd, Prestige Ozone, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560066, India

organizer.name: Fired Up

name: Bangalore Heritage Walk | 17th August 2025
description: Bangalore Heritage Walk Theme: Colonial Bangalore, Royal Legacy & Hidden Alleys Duration: 4–5 hours Start Time: 7:30 AM Ideal For: History buffs, architecture enthusiasts, culture seekers Group Size: Small (8–12 recommended)Price: Rs 2000/head📍 Start Point: St. Mark’s Cathedral7:30 AM – 8:00 AMBegin your walk at this iconic 200-year-old Anglican church.Learn about British-era architecture and Bangalore’s role as a garrison town.Don’t miss the beautifully carved woodwork and stained glass interiors.Tip: Meet at the gate; carry a bottle of water and wear comfortable shoes.🏰 Stop 2: Cubbon Park & Attara Kacheri (High Court)8:10 AM – 9:00 AMWalk through the lush green Cubbon Park, originally laid out in 1870.Pause at Attara Kacheri, the red-painted High Court building built in 1868 in neoclassical style.Hear stories about how Bangalore's legal and civic institutions were shaped here.🏛️ Stop 3: Vidhana Soudha Viewpoint9:05 AM – 9:20 AMA quick halt opposite Vidhana Soudha for a photo op and a brief on post-independence architecture.Discuss the transition from colonial to modern Indian governance.🏯 Stop 4: Bangalore Fort (Kempe Gowda Fort Remains)9:45 AM – 10:15 AMHead to the remnants of the 16th-century fort built by Kempe Gowda, founder of Bangalore.Learn about the original mud fort, Hyder Ali’s renovations, and British conquest.Transport Tip: Short auto ride or cab recommended from Cubbon Park to the Fort area.🕌 Stop 5: Tipu Sultan's Summer Palace10:20 AM – 11:00 AMAdmire Indo-Islamic architecture and ornate teakwood interiors.Dive into Tipu Sultan’s legacy, battles with the British, and resistance stories.🍵 Closing: Breakfast Stop at a Heritage Café11:10 AM – 12:00 PMWind down with a traditional Karnataka breakfast at MTR (Lalbagh Road) or Vidyarthi Bhavan (Basavanagudi).Great place to reflect, chat and enjoy some filter coffee and dosas.📝 What to CarryWater bottleSunglasses/capComfortable walking shoesID proof (for palace entry)Camera/phone for photos

location.address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

name: ☕ Coffee & Co-Working | Open Sky Edition
description: Fluorescent fatigue is real.So we’re stepping outside — embracing garden vibes, soft grass, and the quiet company of open skies.​Bring your work — your laptop, your journal, your half-done dreams.We’ll bring the caffeine, the calm, and the kind of company that lets you be.​There’s no setup. No frills.Just a garden, some good coffee, and a shared intention to slow down and still get things done.​What’s included:🌿 Sit straight on the grass — barefoot☕ A cup of coffee📶 Reliable Wi-Fi🌼 Garden views, open air, and unhurried energy​Let’s reclaim how we work — slowly, softly, under open skies.This is more than co-working.It’s a pause. A protest. A practice in slow living.

name: Italia x Noble Roots (Bar Takeover)
description: You're Invited An Evening of Botanical Cocktails & Global FlavourWe're thrilled to invite you to an exclusive Bar Takeover with Tony Pescatori – international mixologist, flavour specialist, and the creative force behind Noble Roots, Belgrade.This one-night-only experience brings Tony’s signature cocktail artistry to Bangalore – think hyperlocal ingredients, foraged botanicals, and drinks that tell stories from across the world.A globetrotting mixologist and flavor specialist, Tony brings with him a bold new wave of sustainable cocktail culture. With roots in a small Italian village and a journey that has spanned over 40 countries. Formerly the Bar Manager at Nightjar London – a fixture on the World’s 50 Best Bars list – Tony now helms Noble Roots in Belgrade.Expect an immersive evening of thoughtfully crafted cocktails, curated hospitality, and conversations over exceptional drinks.

name: Zine-Making Workshop: Stories of Freedom
description: ​What is freedom, if not the courage to tell your own story?​Come sit with us, and put your truth on paper. In this workshop, you will create a perzine — a personal, handmade magazine filled with your memories, dreams, and reflections.​A perzine is a place where your voice can live freely, in words, images, and art — a diary and a storybook, all your ownNo experience is needed — only your curiosity and heart.​All materials will be provided.Come write your freedom, page by page.

name: Once Upon A Farm!
description: ONCE UPON A FARM!!!A Morning of Play, Animal Stories, and Discovery for FamiliesStep into a joyful, earthy world where stories meet play and imagination runs wild! Designed for children and their grown-ups, this event brings together hands-on fun, cultural storytelling, and sustainable toys — all under one roof.When: Saturday, 9 August, 4:30 pm onwardsWhere: Kavade Store, BangaloreAge group: Best for 2-6 year oldsWhat to Expect: 1. Story CornerSnuggle in for an interactive storytelling sessions featuring delightful tales of Indian farm animals and village life, by seasoned storyteller and author. Join us as we moooooove, sing, and imagine alongside the animals of our countryside.2. Open-Ended Invitation to Play Zones Let curiosity lead the way! Your little ones will explore and discover farm animals through:Sensorial play with hay, stones, sticks, seedsWooden animal figurines and blocks for imaginative role playCraft activities that encourage creative expressionArt and craft activities that foster imagination and develop their fine motor skillsThese activities are designed to foster sensory exploration, self-direction, and shared play.3. Try before you BuyWill my child like it? Will they get bored within 5 minutes? How do I engage my child with an open ended toy like this? Get all these questions answered and more. Explore and test a curated range of wooden, open-ended toys by Gubbacchi Kids with your little ones.  4. Meet The MakersMeet the makers at Gubbacchi Kids! A chance to chat with the creators about toy safety, design, and play philosophy. 5. Join the First ADDA community. It takes a village. Welcome to ours. Meet other likeminded parents, kids, community spaces and brands who are creating a mindful, value aligned childhood ecosystem.

location.address: #143, CKN Chambers, 1st Main Rd, Sripuram, Kumara Park West, Seshadripuram, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560020, India

name: Indigo Workshop
description: INDIGO TIE AND DYE WORKSHOPAn immersive, hands-on session for FamiliesUncover the timeless magic of indigo in this immersive, hands-on workshop that blends art, craft, culture, and sustainability. Indigo is more than just a color - it's a centuries-old dye with deep roots in textile traditions from India, Japan, Africa, and beyond. Known for its rich, deep blue hues, indigo has been used to tell stories, mark identities, and dye fabrics in both everyday life and ceremonial settings.When: Saturday, 9 August, 11 am onwardsWhere: Ambara Store, BangaloreAge group: 10 and aboveIn this workshop, participants will be introduced to the natural indigo dyeing process, understanding how leaves from the indigofera plant are transformed into a vibrant blue pigment through fermentation and oxidation. You'll learn how traditional indigo vats are prepared and witness the magical moment when fabric pulled from the dye appears green and then slowly turns blue before your eyes - a fascinating chemical transformation that's as meditative as it is beautiful.The experience will guide you through various shibori-inspired tie-dye techniques - folding, binding, stitching, clamping, and knotting - to resist dye and create striking, organic patterns. Whether you prefer structured designs or free-flowing experimentation, you’ll have the space and guidance to express your creativity.What to expect:A brief history and cultural background of indigo across different culturesAn introduction to natural dyeing and sustainable textile practicesBrief explanation on preparing and maintaining an indigo vatHands-on experimentation with tie-dye techniquesMindful, sensory engagement with fabric, color, and processThe joy of slow making and crafting something uniquely your ownSuitable for all ages and experience levels, the workshop is a fun, creative, and sensory-rich experience suitable for all skill levels. It is a wonderful way to reconnect with traditional crafts, engage in a tactile learning experience, and walk away with your own hand-dyed bandana.

location.address: 22, Annaswamy Mudaliar Rd, opp. Ulsoor, Rukmani Colony, Lake, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Earth Talks - Healing Soil, Holding Carbon
description: Join us for an enlightning evening hosted by Dr. Babu Padmanabhan Founder, STEER World 11th Aug | 5 – 7 PM At Sabha, Bengaluru event partner In conversation with Nandita Abreo Founder, Firefly Life SciencesDr. Babu Padmanabhan: A pioneer in material innovation, Dr. Babu Padmanabhan founded STEER world to transform how materials are engineered. With a Ph.D. in analytical kinematics and early work with NASA, he developed “Intelligent Compounding, ” impacting industries from polymers to pharma. Through ventures like STEERLife and Phitons, his technologies address challenges like plastic pollution and malnutrition, backed by 30+ inventions and 150+ global patents.Nandita Abreo: Nandita Abreo is the Founder and Director of Firefly Life Sciences, a company focused on transforming agricultural sustainability through innovation and research. She specialises in regenerative agriculture, permaculture, agroforestry, sustainable water systems, clean energy, and fermentation. With a strong focus on circular economy solutions, she champions Firefly’s philosophy of “Applied Sustainability.”Venue: Sabha, Bangalore

name: One Material at a Time
description: With a background in textiles and a Master’s in Material Futures from Central Saint Martins, Shubhi Sachan works at the intersection of craft, science, and sustainability. She founded the Material Library of India to explore circular uses for post-industrial and agricultural waste. Her work challenges conventional disposal methods, advocating for systems that avoid landfills and incineration, and reflects a strong commitment to material innovation and climate conscious design.Venue: Sabha, Bangalore

location.address: 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Putting Weeds to Work
description: Join us for a thought-provoking session with Dr. Tarsh Thekaekara Co-founder, The Shola Trust and The Real Elephant CollectiveDiscover how Lantana camara, a disruptive forest invasive, is being transformed by artisans into striking, sustainable forms that challenge how we see waste and craft. Dr. Tarsh Thekaekara is a conservationist and researcher based in the Nilgiris. He focuses on human-elephant interactions and the removal of Lantana camara through self-sustaining methods. He co-founded The Shola Trust and The Real Elephant Collective, whose lantana sculptures support tribal artisans and raise global awareness.

name: Breathwork with Kavya
description: Breathe Into Balance: From Regulation to TransformationWith Kavya Peerbhoy, Breathwork Facilitator with Ujjayi Movement StudioJoin us for a transformative evening of breath-led healing at The Studio by Copper & Cloves. This immersive worskshop is designed to help you drop out of your busy mind, reconnect with your body, and access deep emotional release and inner clarity through the power of your breath.Workshop Flow•⁠ ⁠Welcome & Introductions•⁠ ⁠Parasympathetic Nervous System Activation •⁠ ⁠Conscious Connected Breathwork Journey •⁠ ⁠Deep Relaxation•⁠ ⁠Sharing Circle with Herbal tea and with light plant-based snacksWhat You Can Expect•⁠ ⁠A safe space to explore your breath•⁠ ⁠Emotional release and nervous system regulation•⁠ ⁠A sense of deep calm, clarity, and groundedness•⁠ ⁠Community connection through shared practice and conversationLongterm Benefits of Breathwork:•⁠ ⁠Nervous system regulation•⁠ ⁠Improved lung capacity and breath awareness•⁠ ⁠Enhanced focus, emotional resilience, and sleep quality•⁠ ⁠Anxiety and stress reduction•⁠ ⁠High vagal tone and restored energy levels•⁠ ⁠Access to non-ordinary states of consciousness•⁠ ⁠Process suppressed emotions and trauma•⁠ ⁠Enhanced self-awareness, intuition, and creativity•⁠ ⁠Release tension and stagnant energy stored in the body•⁠ ⁠Creates space for clarity, insights, and healingAbout our Breathwork Facilitator: Kavya Peerbhoy After spending over two decades leading global marketing teams across some of the world’s most influential brands, Kavya found herself facing burnout, chronic stress, anxiety, and depression. She discovered the transformative power of the breath to regulate emotions, release stored trauma, and reconnect to a sense of inner balance. Today, she holds space for others on their healing journeys, helping them access the power of the breath to heal, grow, and rediscover their authentic selves.

name: The Playbook | Experience Learning Through Play
description: What if play wasn’t a break from learning but the heart of it?Join us for The Playbook, Papagoya’s flagship 1-day play experience that brings together leading minds in education, design, and neuroscience to challenge how we think about play in Indian learning spaces.This isn’t a celebration of play for play’s sake; it’s a call to redesign our classrooms, curriculums, and mindsets around one of the most powerful tools for cognitive, emotional, and social development: Play.Explore how storytelling, food, architecture, and even AI can spark curiosityParticipate in hands-on mini-courses that reimagine learning through the sensesWhether you're an educator, designer, policymaker, or parent, this day is for anyone who believes that the future of learning must start with joy.Limited seats available. Come play seriously.

name: Rethinking What's Next: Realigning with Purpose
description: Are you living with choice, meaning, and purpose?So often, our dreams and aspirations get buried in the everyday rush.This workshop offers you the space to pause, listen inward, and realign with what matters most.Take the pause now. Begin shaping what’s next. Facilitator: Ragini RaoJoin her in this offline workshop to:Reflect on what drives youRethink patterns that no longer serveMap your way forward with clarity and confidenceRagini Rao is a Teaching and Supervising Transactional Analyst TSTA(P). She trains and supervises advanced training groups in Transactional Analysis to become Psychotherapists, Coaches and Trainers. With over 5000 hours of one-on-one and group counselling and therapy, over a span of 30 years, she has addressed problems pertaining to Relationships, Marital Issues, Depression, Grief, Low Self Esteem and Sexual, Verbal and Physical Abuse. Ragini is also a licensed workshop leader for the “Heal your Life” programs based on the philosophy of world renowned author Louise L. Hay. She conducts the Heal Your Life workshops in offline settings.

location.address: 7, 4th Main Rd, Stage 2, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

organizer.name: Zuva Life
organizer.description: We change—and sometimes the life around us needs to catch up. Zuva Life offers gentle spaces to pause, reflect, and reimagine what comes next. These experiences invite you to explore life’s shifts with curiosity, not pressure. A soft place to wonder, not to fix.

name: Coro Off Duty: Supper Club
description: Coro Off Duty: A Night for You, While the Kids Play TooJoin us for an intimate, themed Supper Club evening at Coro - a beautiful night of grazing, mingling, and meaningful conversation with fellow parents. While you unwind and connect over a hand-curated menu of continental-inspired bites (think Chicken Filo Moussaka, Creamy Pesto Gnocchi, and Orange Portokalopita), your little ones will be entertained at our cozy Pajama Party, complete with open-ended play and gentle supervision.Whether you're looking to make new connections or simply enjoy a slow evening with familiar faces, this one’s for you. Limited spots. Real talk. Great food. No judgment.About the chef:Chef Samara - originally from Bangalore, raised in Dubai - where she was lucky to grow up surrounded by friends from all over the world. That early exposure to diverse cultures and cuisines sparked her curiosity in the kitchen.What she loves most about being a chef is the freedom to explore flavours and techniques from different parts of the world and blend them into something new. There’s nothing more fulfilling than watching someone enjoy a meal she's created: it’s where all the effort finds its purpose.

name: Jyotsna Srikanth - Live at the record store
description: Experience an evening of musical brilliance with Jyotsna Srikanth, Europe’s foremost Indian violinist, accompanied by the versatile Solomon Shadrach on keys. Hailing from Bangalore and now based in London, Jyotsna is celebrated for her extraordinary artistry and her ability to illuminate the Carnatic tradition with vibrant, contemporary expression. Her performances seamlessly blend the intricacies of Indian classical music with the spontaneity of jazz and global sounds, captivating audiences worldwide—from Buckingham Palace to WOMEX in Poland.Join us at Ram’s Musique Experience, MG Road, on Saturday, August 9th, 2025, at 7:00pm for a night where tradition meets innovation.

name: The Little Big's Sustainability Studio
description: The Little Big's Sustainability Studio is a hands-on + play-based Life Skills Workshop where children and their families rediscover the value of repair, reuse, and conscious consumption. It’s a space to build practical skills, nurture sustainable habits, and take small, powerful steps toward a future that cares for what we have—and what we leave behind.Workshop 1: All Things Fabric invites families to bring things that they would like to Repair (Clothes/ Bags/ Zippers)Upcycle existing fabric to make a variety of lifestyle products for each member of the family including their furry friends.Create a whole new look for their existing Denims (Jackets/ Jeans/Bags) that can be brought in/ shopped at our Thrift StoresAll this through fun quizzes and games on Sustainability!Limited to 25 Families on First come First Serve Basis only

name: Common Chord - Jam Night
description: Step into the rhythm of Common Chord - Jam Night at MyBoTree. A cozy evening where unplugged music, moods, and minds meet. No stage, no pressure but just a shared love for sound and spontaneous expression. Let the music flow, let it take control, all and everyone are welcome.Whether you’re a musician, poet, singer, storyteller, or just someone who finds joy in listening, this space is for you. Come as you are, bring what you have, and let’s find our common chord.Everyone’s welcome - performers, listeners, supporters and wanderers

organizer.name: MyBoTree
organizer.description: MyBoTree, founded by three women, is a vibrant hub for purpose-driven programs focused on joyful, transformative experiences that empower communities and individuals to grow and connect. They actively partner with social enterprises and non-profits.

name: Half-day Someone | A board game designer
description: 🎲 Step into the World of Board Game Design!Have you thought about how board games go from an idea to a tabletop hit? Spend half a day with a passionate board game designer, diving into the world of strategy, storytelling, and playful creativity. This experience will let you peek behind the curtain of board game design, level up your analytical thinking, unlock your creative side, and walk away with a mini-game you dreamed up!What you'll do -Icebreaker & IntroductionMeet your host - Sai.Get a quick intro to the world of board game design: genres, mechanics, and what makes a game tick.Play a short warm-up game to loosen up and spark ideas.Design Basics & BrainstormingLearn about key elements: game mechanics, theme, components, and balance.Brainstorm concepts in small groups or pairs.Pick an idea and sketch out your mini-game concept.Prototype & PlaytestUse simple materials (paper, tokens, dice) to prototype your game.Playtest your creations—see what works and what needs tweaking!Feedback & IterationDiscuss what worked, what didn’t, and how real designers iterate.Learn practical tips on testing, publishing, and joining the board game community.✨ What You’ll Leave With:A mini-game concept of your ownInsights into how board games are designed, tested, and brought to lifeA fun half-day packed with creativity, collaboration, and a dose of friendly competition!

name: Salt in the Honey - An evening with Nusrat
description: Salt in the Honey: An Evening with Nusrat Fateh Ali KhanExperience the subtle complexities and emotional depth of Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan’s legendary qawwali music in an intimate listening session.This event invites you to step beyond the familiar and explore the sacred warmth and nuanced longing that defines Nusrat’s voice and artistry. Through carefully selected tracks, including traditional qawwali pieces and boundary-crossing collaborations, we’ll uncover the textures and transcendent moments embedded in his music.Join us for an evening of focused listening, gentle discussion, and shared reflection. Whether you’re new to Nusrat’s world or a longtime admirer, this session offers a quiet space to connect deeply with one of South Asia’s most profound musical voices.Limited seats available.

name: Film Screening - Hyenas
description: Hyenas (1992)By Djibril Diop Mambéty / 110' / WolofA now-rich woman returns to her poor desert hometown to propose a deal to the populace: her fortune, in exchange for the death of the man who years earlier abandoned her and left her with his child. A Senegalese film inspired by Friedrich Dürrenmatt's Swiss-German satirical tragicomedy play The Visit (1956), is an intimate story of love and revenge that also parallels a critique of neocolonialism and African consumerism.

name: Coro Commons
description: Welcome to Coro Commons!A new kind of community gathering. A slower kind of bazaar.Coro Commons is our way of opening up the Coro spirit to everyone with a vibrant, one-day gathering where stalls, stories, and shared experiences come together under one roof. While it may look like a market, it’s more than that. This is a space to create, connect, and be, with hands-on experiences for both kids and adults, playful interactions, creative expressions, and yes, some beautiful things to take home too.We’re thrilled to be hosting Merchants of Happiness - India’s first-ever child-led pop-up - built on the belief that children are not just the future, but the present. Over the past two years, MOH has worked with over 600 children across schools and NGOs, co-creating joyful, inclusive spaces where children aged 7 to 21 lead their own stalls, offering everything from food and books to pre-loved toys, DIY stations, and delightful performances.Though Coro is a space that celebrates parents and families, Coro Commons is for everyone. Whether you’re coming with a little one in tow, on your own, or with a friend, you’ll find something that sparks joy, curiosity, or a new connection. And in the spirit of truly welcoming families, all kids walk in free - no age limits, no exceptions.We’re not here to sell stuff. We’re here to gather with purpose—to make space for mess, meaning, and a little magic.This isn’t just a bazaar. This is Coro Commons. Let’s gather differently.At Coro, we also care deeply about sustainability. In that spirit, we gently encourage you to take public transport where possible. While we don’t have dedicated parking, there’s ample space to park on the street if you choose to drive in.

location.address: XJ6P+7VC, Kempegowda Service Rd, near Paramahansa Yogananda Road, Domlur I Stage, 1st Stage, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

name: OriginalDog presents Unfiltered: Blues
description: An evening of Original entertainment from OriginalDog“For me there is something primitively soothing about this music, and it went straight to my nervous system, making me feel ten feet tall.” ― Eric ClaptonWhat is about this genre of music that evokes so much emotion? What is the history behind the evolution of this musical form?OriginalDog presents ‘Unfiltered’, is an evening of discovering something new, having an unique experience and in the process have a new unfiltered view of this world.Join us as we journey into the world of the Blues.Writer and blues enthusiast Kavya Murthy will take us on an audio-visual journey through the history of the Blues.Also joining us will be Bruce from TAAQ, who will share some of his latest experiments with blues-y forms, and perhaps even share a song or two, live!See you at Unfiltered!

organizer.description: We're a community center for thoughtful, kind, and interesting events.

name: Whimsical Weekend with Improv Lore
description: We bring you some whimsy this weekend for those who can’t make it to our Wednesday jams.Whether you’re a novice to theatre, a maverick on stage, or just dipping your toes into the world of unscripted performance, this Jam is designed for everyone. Our facilitators will guide you through a series of engaging improv exercises, help you explore new characters, and set up scenarios that will make your inner wit shine - all on the spot!Come as you are, leave your inhibitions at the door, and join us on this journey of endless possibility.Bring a friend, a date, or a group - our brave space is for everyone!Who are Improv Lore?We are Bangalore-based community-theatre troupe, works towards spreading the art of spontaneous storytelling & unscripted stagecraft, and rekindling the joy of being playful & whimsical. We meet on Wednesdays for Jams, and on weekends for workshops.You can follow us on Instagram at @improvlore and join our WhatsApp community.

location.address: 3rd Floor, above Blue Tokai, #24 3rd A Cross, 1st Main Rd, Defence Colony, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

organizer.name: Underline Center
organizer.description: We're a community center for thoughtful, kind, and interesting events.

name: Jigsaw Junkies by Playful Pursuits
description: When was the last time you put a jigsaw puzzle together? Puzzles are for everyone! Whether you loved puzzles as a kid or enjoy them now; do them solo or with friends and family; take your time or love to blitz a puzzle - Jigsaw Junkies is for you!Join us for a relaxed off-screen afternoon in a social setting while you put together beautiful images. We’ve tied up with some of India’s most innovative puzzle companies to bring you new and exciting jigsaws to solve during this day-long event!Come alone, with a partner, with friends or family! We will have something for everyone. (Under-18s may attend if accompanied by an adult.)Who is Playful Pursuits?We are Bangalore’s first jigsaw puzzle meetup group, providing a space for puzzle enthusiasts to come together to solve jigsaws, swap and sell their puzzles, and compete in speed puzzling! We meet in-person every Monday and on the occasional weekend.You can follow us on Instagram at @playful.pursuits and join our WhatsApp group.

name: Ceramic Sneaker Postcard Painting
description: Ceramic Sneaker Postcard Painting with Socially Silly Unleash your creativity and bring your dream sneaker to life - on a ceramic postcard! What to expect: A unique 3D ceramic sneaker postcard—yours to design! All painting materials provided (just bring your imagination!) A chance to paint your dream sneaker with your own custom design A relaxing, creative experience perfect for sneakerheads & art lovers alike Take home your one-of-a-kind masterpieceLet your inner designer shine—no experience needed, just good vibes and creativity!About the artist: Socially Silly is a community of friends who thrive on art, craft, fun conversations and shared interests. We organize workshops and silly little art parties that give people the leisure of taking their time exploring their creativity and unwinding. We would like everybody to be able to join us, even if they’ve never picked up a paintbrush before. We’re creating a safe space together to explore and make something with your own hands. Come embrace the mess, the mistakes and get silly with us

organizer.description: We're a community center for thoughtful, kind, and interesting events.

name: Pasolini Pa* Palestine (2005) with TPCC
description: “Pasolini Pa* Palestine is an attempt to repeat Pasolini’s trip to Palestine in his film, It adapts his script into a route map superimposed on the current landscape, creating contradictions and breaks between the visual and the audible, the expected and the real.The video explores the question of repetition. For Heidegger Wiederholung ‘repetition, retrieval’ is one of the terms he uses for the appropriate attitude toward the past. “By the repetition of a basic problem we understand the disclosure of its original, so far hidden possibilities.”Our meetings consist of a screening of an arthouse film, followed by a discussion. The discussion is led by one of our members or sometimes a guest speaker and encourages members to share their thoughts and interpretations of the film.Who are The Parallel Cinema Club?A community-run film society, we are a collective of film enthusiasts who gather weekly to explore the world of cinema, discuss auteurs and themes, and occasionally host guest lectures. You follow us on Instagram on @theparallelcinemaclub and join our WhatsApp community.

name: Film Screening " Ali : Fear Eats the Soul "
description: Ali : Fear Eats The Soul (1974)By Rainer Werner Fassbinder / 93' / German An older lonely widow meets a much younger Arab worker in a bar during a rainstorm. They fall in love, to their own surprise and to the outright shock of their families, colleagues, and drinking buddies.In Ali: Fear Eats the Soul, Fassbinder expertly wields the emotional power of classic Hollywood melodrama to expose the racial tensions underlying contemporary German culture.

name: Lions Gate Full Moon Healing Circle
description: A sacred evening to gather in circle…To remember what our ancestors never forgot -how to sit together,breathe together,release what’s oldand call in what’s true.This 8:8 portal opens with the Full Moon in Aquarius (Vedic Astrology) - a powerful window of activation, release and remembrance.We’ll start with a short round of introductions, a grounding practice and a simple talk on the energy of this full moon.Guided by the elements of fire and air, we’ll journey through:🍫 Cacao Ceremony to open the heart and ground into the body🌳 Honoring the Ancestors – A Family Constellation Ritual to reconnect with our roots🔥 Tummo Breathwork to awaken inner fire🕯 Fire Release Ceremony to offer old stories to the flames - invoking the bold Lion within🎶 Vocal Chakra Toning + Voice Activation – carried on the air to awaken truth and higher guidance.We’ll close with a tarot guidance and space to share.Please bring a diary to journal, water or a shawl to feel cozy and comfortable.About the Facilitator:Maria is a psychic healer and guide, weaving 9 years of energy work into transformational spaces for emotional, spiritual and psychological healing. After a thriving corporate career in management, she followed the call of her soul to support others in their inner journeys. Her sessions blend Breathwork, Reiki, Access Bars, EFT, Tarot, Shadow Constellations, Active Meditations, Cacao Ceremonies and Shakta Tantra.

organizer.name: Ethereal Vibes
organizer.description: Ethereal Vibes is where soulful healing meets cosmic sass. With 8+ years in energy work, I offer transformative sessions blending Breathwork, Reiki, Shadow Constellations, Access Bars and Tarot plus Reiki-infused products like chakra salts and crystal bracelets to support daily ritual and self-care.
